alert.note: Alert for Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Webster and west central Clay Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Clarkson, or 14 miles west of Montpelier, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clarkson around 525 PM CDT. Cumberland around 540 PM CDT. Montpelier around 600 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Mantee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Mississippi.
